info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 12:38PM EDT until April 8 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Charleston WV
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Charleston WV has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in West Virginia...Ohio... Kentucky...
Ohio River Near Huntington affecting Lawrence, Cabell, Boyd and Wayne Counties.
For the Ohio River...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Ohio River near Huntington.
* WHEN...From late Sunday night to Tuesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 50.0 feet, WV Route 2 at Glenwood floods. Many low lying sections near the river flood due to backwater.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 45.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Monday morning to a crest of 50.1 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 50.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 50.1 feet on 01/13/1974. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1245 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT TO TUESDAY MORNING

area.areaDesc: Boyd, KY; Lawrence, OH; Cabell, WV; Wayne, WV
